channel.title: Compile problems
channel.description: i use newest 4.2richscape source en like all richscape sources i can't compile .. my compiler can't find java.client en stuff whit this compiler:[code]@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit[/code] en if i use [code]@echo off title Compiling... cd Source "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./*java pause[/code] It say this..: The device is not ready. Press any key to continue. . . PLS help me whit this:s does maybe some1 know better compiler that works for this problem?:|

item.title: Compile problems
item.dc:creator: @Beasty_x Beasty_x
item.description:
@Beasty_x wrote:

[quote=“Cry 0f Death, post:2, topic:251005”]It seems that you do not have Java installed, or your compilers are looking for the wrong update. If you do not have it installed, get the latest update from http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp. I think Jdk6u11 is the most recent right now.
If this still doesn’t work then…
Go to the compiler you wish to use and right click on it, then press edit. Look for where it says

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javac.exe

or something of the sort. You must replace the update they have such as jdk1.7.0 with yours. So if you downloaded Jdk6u11 replace it with jdk1.6.0_11. If this does not work and I have missed something let me know, I’m multi tasking :o[/quote]Pff it don’t work i deleted all Jre en JDK’s unless the 1.6.0_07 en i installed Jre 6 update 11 en i installed JDK 6 Update 11 en i change my compiler from 1.7.0 in to 1.6.0_11 en this still came up : The device is not ready.
Press any key to continue. . . PS: i can compile other servers the only i can’t is Richscape sources…-.- e i think i know why : He don’t place he’s client.java files on the place where compiler is…

Read full topic

item.title: Compile problems
item.dc:creator: @Cry_0f_Death Cry 0f Death
item.description:
@Cry_0f_Death wrote:

It seems that you do not have Java installed, or your compilers are looking for the wrong update. If you do not have it installed, get the latest update from http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp. I think Jdk6u11 is the most recent right now.
If this still doesn’t work then…
Go to the compiler you wish to use and right click on it, then press edit. Look for where it says

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javac.exe

or something of the sort. You must replace the update they have such as jdk1.7.0 with yours. So if you downloaded Jdk6u11 replace it with jdk1.6.0_11. If this does not work and I have missed something let me know, I’m multi tasking :o

Read full topic

item.title: Compile problems
item.dc:creator: @Beasty_x Beasty_x
item.description:
@Beasty_x wrote:

i use newest 4.2richscape source en like all richscape sources i can’t compile … my compiler can’t find java.client en stuff whit this compiler:@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit en if i use @echo off title Compiling... cd Source "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./*java pause It say this…: The device is not ready.
Press any key to continue. . . PLS help me whit this:s does maybe some1 know better compiler that works for this problem?
